title: Moles of NO formed from 0.10 mol Ag added to HNO3

content.prompt:
3 Ag(s) + 4 HNO3 → 3 AgNO3 + NO(g) + 2 H2O

The reaction of silver metal and dilute nitric acid proceeds according to the equation above. If 0.10 mole of powdered silver is added to 10. milliliters of 6.0–molar nitric acid, the number of moles of NO gas that can be formed is

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
